ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: There wasn't a TA

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: I audited the class, so I don't have much to say about the assignments or feedback from the professor.
The course really makes me interested in English writing, thank you, Fred!
The professor's teaching style. He was very engaging and helped us digest the readings in a very clear way.
Workshopping
The teacher is very interesting, and the course is interactive
Interactive and applicable to my goals
The readings were useful and relevant and the instructor's comments on the readings and writing assignments were extremely insightful and useful.
receiving feedback on an article about the topic I chose.
I appreciated having a forum to learn about writing, a clear motivation to write, and the context of good writing in the environmental arena.
Instructor, the readings, and the dinner with Verlyn Klinkenborg was wonderful!

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Maybe fewer readings - sometimes we read maybe 20 articles but only covered 3-4 in class.
A little more structure and theory separate from the reading discussions
there are no suggestions - I thought the class was well taught and well organized
The instructor sometimes didn't address students' comments.
The timing. I don't like leaving campus so late!

The instructor very tightly controls the discussion. I never felt like I could speak to or with my classmates - it was ALWAYS through the instructor who moderated virtually everything that was said. He is clearly an expert on the material and skillful in moderating a workshop, but sometimes he needs to take a backseat to the rest of the class so they can communicate amongst themselves.
More small group workshops

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: The professor was very accessible and helpful. There was no TA.
Very helpful indeed
Quick to respond to emails and available to talk as needed
The instructor was very available and provided in-depth feedback on assignments that went beyond that of any other course. Very helpful.
Top notch.
Excellent, Fred goes above and beyond to improve your writing

The instructor was very available during class and just after. I do wish he had office hours outside of class, but I understand why he does not. He invited us to call him at home with questions, but it's intimidating to call an instructor at home, so I didn't and I don't know anyone who did.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: For my master's project I want to publish an article, so I thought this course would help me learn about writing styles and strategies.
for anyone wishing to use popular media as a method of publicising or publishing their work this is an excellent class.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: See question 15
Want to learn about writing
Interest in writing and using popular media
I wanted to improve my writing skills and was happy to see that FES offered such a course.
I wanted to write and publish an article.
I wanted to gain experience in writing.
To learn how to be a writer about environmental issues

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
Yes
Yes
Yes
Yes.
Yes
Yes, very much so.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
Yes
I got more from this class than I expected
yes and more.
Yes.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Work groups were in the second half of the class and were helpful in completing the article
The work group was one of the most valuable parts of the course. Itwas great to get such in-depth feedback from peers as well as the instructor.
Really useful

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It's a great class. I highly recommend it.
Give it enough time for reading and writing to get the most out of it
Take the course for 3 credits, as the work group sessions the second half of class are very valuable.
